chapter.title: Tar packages
chapter.para:
Currently only tar.gz packages are available. The packages can be found in CVS /cdk/packages/tar. These packages can be installed on UNIX type operating systems in a few steps (replace the 20020206 with the latest release date):
$ gunzip cdk-libs-20020206.tar.gz $ tar xvf cdk-libs-20020206.tar $ cd cdk-libs-20020206 $ ./configure && make && install
Remember the correct order of installation is: cdk-libs, cdk-bin, cdk-test.

chapter.title: Linux packages
chapter.para: At this moment Linux users should use and install the above tar.gz packages, unless they are Debian users. They can install a Debian package.

section.title: Debian packages
section.para:
Debian packages are available from the SourceForge website and can be build from CVS. To build Debian packages, first recompile CDK with "ant dist-all" to make fresh and up to data jar's. Then build the Debian packages in the directory packages/debian. First build libcdkextra which is the Debian package for CDK's cdk-libs tar package. It includes only those jars that are not packaged in other Debian packages. The next package to build is libcdk, which include the CDK jar files. It build-depends on libcdkextra, so you will need to install that one first. The last package to build is the package cdk. These latter two correspond to the CDK tar package cdk-bin. All debian packages are build by typing the following in the appropriate directory:
$ make deb
